title: Rachel Adedeji and Daisy Wood Davis stun on the Inside Soap Awards red carpet
text:
Get the biggest soaps stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The ladies of the soap world brought some much needed glamour to the Inside Soap Awards red carpet in their stylish outfits.

Former X Factor star Rachel Adedeji lead the way alongside her Hollyoaks co-stars.

She smiled away as she walked the red carpet wearing a pink ruffled mini dress with a pair of see-through plastic heels.

Coronation Street star Katie McGlynn, who has already filmed her exit scenes as Sinead Tinker also showed up in an all-white tuxedo dress look.

Rachel's fellow Hollyoaks castmate Daisy Wood Davis stunned in a bold form-fitting dogtooth print jumpsuit and nude PVC boots.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

She completed her look with an over the shoulder black handbag and glossy curled locks that cascaded over her shoulder.

Daisy, who played Kim Butterfield was also joined by her fiancé and co-star Luke Jerdy at the event, they just recently celebrated their own real-life engagement with a swish party full of their friends.

Rukku Nahar, who plays Habiba Ahmed on EastEnders, brought the Hollywood glamour in a bright red dress and a glittering gold bra top.

She wore her hair in a high ponytail swung over one shoulder and sported a dark smokey eye.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

Corrie star Katie McGlynn opted for her favourite red carpet colour - white.

She looked incredible in the bold suited dress with a cape.

Keeping things simple she grasped a black clutch and had her hair swept in an up do, adding a pop of colour with a dark red lip.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

(Image: Getty Images)

Bhavna Limbachia from Coronation Street brought smouldering sex appeal in her fitted black dress.

With delicate lace finishes across her chest and skirt, she went for a classic twenties pinned hairstyle.

Hollyoaks beauty Jessamy Stoddart went for a divisive look wearing a black see-through ruffled top with a pair of black shorts and knee-high boots.

She went for a fresh pink make-up glow adding blush on her cheeks and a soft pink on her lips.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

Lauren McQueen, who plays Lily Drinkwell in Hollyoaks, opted for a smart look with a glittery twist.

She donned a white two-piece and a sparkling one-shoulder top underneath her jacket, all topped off with a matching silver clutch and heeled sandals.

Priya Davdra from EastEnders also brightened up the red carpet with a sparkling mirror-style dress.

The much-anticipated annual ceremony took place tonight at London venue, Sway, and was attended by the cream of British soap.

Hollyoaks were the big winners of the Inside Soap Awards picking up gongs in all the major categories as well as being crowned Best Soap for the first time ever.

(Image: WireImage)

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

The Channel 4 soap has been on the air since 1995 and six years before the inaugural Inside Soap Awards back in 2001.

And the cast and crew of the drama filled soap have plenty of reasons to celebrate after beating off stiff competition from legendary shows EastEnders, Coronation Street and Emmerdale to be crowned the finest of them all.

Ripplingly muscular hunk Adam Woodward, who has played Brody Hudson, was crowned Best Actor in the awards, while reality star, singer and actress Stephanie Davis, who plays Sinead Shelby, was awarded Best Actress.
description: The ladies of the soap world brought some glitz and glamour to the ceremony in stylish outfits
